form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes several questions about the respondent's current job, including the job title, industry, activities, when the job was started, hours spent working each week, and normal hours of the day worked. Occupation and industry entries are coded using the Standardized Occupational Classification System (SOC) and the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes from the U.S. Census Bureau.The respondent is asked a number of questions about his longest held job, including name of occupation, industry, types of activities performed, and length of time worked.As an alternative, the respondent is asked specific details about every job he/she has had for 6 months or longer since he/she was 16 years old. Information obtained about each job includes: the name of the company, job title, when the job started and stopped, address of the company, whether it was full-time, part-time, or seasonal work, type of business, main activities on the job, chemicals and materials handled, and tools and equipment used.

question.questionText: Note: in many situations a complete occupational history is not feasible, so the current occupation and longest held job are the primary measure. A complete occupational history should be captured for investigations of chronic diseases or workrelated injuries. (occupation_intro)
How many hours did {you/sample person} work last week at all jobs or businesses? (working_hours_last_week)
How many hours did {you/sample person} work last week at all jobs or businesses? (working_hours_last_week_coded)
{Do you/Does sample person} usually work 35 hours or more per week in total at all jobs or businesses? (job_35_hours_per_week)

For whom did {you/sample person} work at {your/his/her} main job or business? (What is the name of the company, business, organization, or employer?) IF MORE THAN 1 JOB, PROBE FOR MAIN JOB. (job_employer)
For whom did {you/SP} work at {your/his/her} main job or business? (What is the name of the company, business, organization or employer?) IF MORE THAN 1 JOB, PROBE FOR MAIN JOB. (job_employer_coded)
What kind of business or industry is this? (For example: a TV or radio station, retail shoe store, state labor department, farm.) (job_business_industry)
What kind of business or industry is this? (For example: a TV or radio station, retail shoe store, state labor department, farm.) (job_business_industry_coded)
What kind of work {were you/was sample person} doing? (For example: farming, mail clerk, computer specialist, machine operator, welder, mechanic.) (job_occupation)
What kind of work {were you/was sample person} doing? (For example: farming, mail clerk, computer specialist, machine operator, welder, mechanic.) (job_occupation_coded)
What were {your/sample person's} most important activities on this job? (For example: sells cars, keeps account books, operates printing press.) (job_duties)
What were {your/sample person's} most important activities on this job? (For example: sells cars, keeps account books, operates printing press.) (job_duties_coded)

Which of the following best describes the hours {you/sample person} usually {work/works} at {your/his/her} main job or business? Standard Shift Definitions are: A regular daytime schedule: this is work anytime between 6am and 6pm. A regular evening shift: this is work anytime between 2pm and midnight.A regular night shift: this is work anytime between 9pm and 8am.A rotating shift: a work shift that changes periodically from days to evenings or nights. Another schedule includes: a split shift (consisting of two distinct work periods each day), an irregular schedule arranged by the employer, or any other schedule. (job_shift_schedule)
About how long {have you/has sample person} worked for {EMPLOYER} as a(n) {OCCUPATION}? ENTER NUMBER (OF DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS OR YEARS) (job_duration)
About how long {have you/has sample person} worked for {EMPLOYER} as a(n) {OCCUPATION}? (job_duration_coded)
About how long {have you/has sample person} worked for {EMPLOYER} as a(n) {OCCUPATION}? (job_duration_unit)

Thinking of all the paid jobs {you/sample person} ever had, what kind of work {were you/was s/he} doing the longest? (For example, electrical engineer, stock clerk, typist, farmer.) (longest_job_occupation)

Thinking of all the paid jobs {you/sample person} ever had, what kind of work {were you/was s/he} doing the longest? (For example, electrical engineer, stock clerk, typist, farmer.) (longest_job_occupation_coded)

What kind of business or industry {did you/did sample person} work in for the longest period of time as a (DISPLAY LONGEST OCCUPATION)? (For example, a TV or radio station, retail shoe store, state labor department, farm, plastics manufacturer.) (longest_job_industry)

What kind of business or industry {did you/did sample person} work in for the longest period of time as a (DISPLAY LONGEST OCCUPATION)? (For example, a TV or radio station, retail shoe store, state labor department, farm, plastics manufacturer.) (longest_job_industry_coded)
What were {your/sample person's} most important activities on this job or business? (For example: sells cars, keeps account books, operates printing press.) (longest_job_duties)
What were {your/sample person's} most important activities on this job or business? (For example: sells cars, keeps account books, operates printing press.) (longest_job_duties_coded)
About how long did {you/sample person} work at that job or business? (longest_job_duration)
About how long did {you/sample person} work at that job or business? (longest_job_duration_coded)
About how long did {you/sample person} work at that job or business? (longest_job_duration_unit)

Since the age 16, did (you/your _______) ever work for six months or more? We are interested in every job, parttime or fulltime, paid or unpaid, that (you/he/she) held for 6 months or longer. (job_history_since_age_16)
What was the name of the company where (you/he/she) (first/next) worked for 6 months or longer? (job_history_employer_1)
What was the job title of the (first/next) job (you/your _______) held at this company? (job_history_title_1)
In what year did (you/he/she) start working at this job? (job_history_year_start_1)
In what year did (you/he/she) stop working at this job? (job_history_year_stop_1)
What was the location of this company? Address, City/State (job_history_company_address_1)
Was this a fulltime or parttime job? (IF UNCLEAR, ASK: Was it yearround or not?) (job_history_full_time_1)
What did they make, or what service did they provide? (ENTER RESPONSE VERBATIM AND CIRCLE APPROPRIATE CODE.) What type of business was it? (job_history_business_industry_1)
What were (your/your _____'s) main activities or duties for this job? (job_history_duties_1)
What kinds of chemicals or materials did (you/he/she) handle in that job? (job_history_chemical_material_1)
What kinds of tools and equipment did (you/he/she) use? (job_history_tool_equipment_1)
What was the name of the company where (you/he/she) (first/next) worked for 6 months or longer? (job_history_employer_2)
What was the job title of the (first/next) job (you/your _______) held at this company? (job_history_title_2)
In what year did (you/he/she) start working at this job? (job_history_year_start_2)
In what year did (you/he/she) stop working at this job? (job_history_year_stop_2)
What was the location of this company? Address, City/State (job_history_company_address_2)
Was this a fulltime or parttime job? (IF UNCLEAR, ASK: Was it yearround or not?) (job_history_full_time_2)
What did they make, or what service did they provide? (ENTER RESPONSE VERBATIM AND CIRCLE APPROPRIATE CODE.) What type of business was it? (job_history_business_industry_2)
What were (your/your _____'s) main activities or duties for this job? (job_history_duties_2)
What kinds of chemicals or materials did (you/he/she) handle in that job? (job_history_chemical_material_2)
What kinds of tools and equipment did (you/he/she) use? (job_history_tool_equipment_2)
What was the name of the company where (you/he/she) (first/next) worked for 6 months or longer? (job_history_employer_3)
What was the job title of the (first/next) job (you/your _______) held at this company? (job_history_title_3)
In what year did (you/he/she) start working at this job? (job_history_year_start_3)
In what year did (you/he/she) stop working at this job? (job_history_year_stop_3)
What was the location of this company? Address, City/State (job_history_company_address_3)
Was this a fulltime or parttime job? (IF UNCLEAR, ASK: Was it yearround or not?) (job_history_full_time_3)
What did they make, or what service did they provide? (ENTER RESPONSE VERBATIM AND CIRCLE APPROPRIATE CODE.) What type of business was it? (job_history_business_industry_3)

In what year did (you/he/she) start working at this job? (job_history_year_start_4)

Was this a fulltime or parttime job? (IF UNCLEAR, ASK: Was it yearround or not?) (job_history_full_time_4)
What did they make, or what service did they provide? (ENTER RESPONSE VERBATIM AND CIRCLE APPROPRIATE CODE.) What type of business was it? (job_history_business_industry_4)

What kinds of chemicals or materials did (you/he/she) handle in that job? (job_history_chemical_material_4)

WHO PROVIDED MOST OF THE RESPONSES IN THIS SECTION? (job_provided_most_responses)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes several questions about the respondent's current job, including the job title, industry, activities, when the job was started, hours spent working each week, and normal hours of the day worked. Occupation and industry entries are coded using the Standardized Occupational Classification System (SOC) and the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes from the U.S. Census Bureau.The respondent is asked a number of questions about his longest held job, including name of occupation, industry, types of activities performed, and length of time worked.As an alternative, the respondent is asked specific details about every job he/she has had for 6 months or longer since he/she was 16 years old. Information obtained about each job includes: the name of the company, job title, when the job started and stopped, address of the company, whether it was full-time, part-time, or seasonal work, type of business, main activities on the job, chemicals and materials handled, and tools and equipment used.
